result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric D. Amundson

records.addlTxt:
3:52 PM Defendant Eric D. Amundson in court.  Attorney Robert A Kennedy Jr. in court for Eric D. Amundson.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. State here for PH, believes it will be a waiver, offer extended to waive, for a misdemeanor conviction, no new charges and to settle before trial.  Court goes over preliminary hearing questionnaire waiver, finds defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Information has been filed. Attorney has received a copy of information, waives further reading, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas and will have set for DA PTC and PLEAS.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 7, 2023 at 11:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 1, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 7, 2023 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Adjourned plea hearing on October 13, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
2:33 PM defendant in person attny Kennedy in person. ADA Alex Seifert appears in person. ADA- not sure where witnesses are. 10/5/22 1:30 Attny Kennedy- waived time limits. Adj 2:37 PM

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
10:05 AM Defendant Eric D. Amundson in court.  Attorney Robert A Kennedy Jr. in court for Eric D. Amundson.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Kennedy and Amundson have complaint, waives reading, requests PH, will waive time limits. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond, set for PH on 9/28/22 at 2:30 PM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric D. Amundson in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Court reviews file - asks why he does not have counsel with him today. Amundson shows Court a receipt that he has retained Attorney Kennedy. Court will allow one more adjournment as defendant just retained Attorney Kennedy this morning, continues bond, sets for AIA on 9/14/22 at 10:00 AM, inform Kennedy of date and time.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Not to acquire any additional animals.

9:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric D. Amundson in court. Amundson has received a copy of the complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. Amundson has contacted Robert Kennedy, but needs to come up with retainer. Court advises of options for obtaining an attorney, SPD, private hire or court appointed if not eligible for SPD. Amundson understands and will be saving to retain Kennedy. State asks for $100 signature bond. Court questions Amundson on if he currently has animals. Amundson responds. Court imposes $100 signature, is to not take on anymore animals.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
